de.sub.goobi.helper

Class DateUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.sub.goobi.helper.DateUtils

  • public class DateUtils
extends Object
    The class DateUtils contains an omnium-gatherum of functions that work on calendar dates. All functionality is realized using the org.joda.time.* library.
    Author:
    Matthias Ronge <matthias.ronge@zeutschel.de>

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static org.joda.time.format.DateTimeFormatter DATE_FORMATTER
      The field DATE_FORMATTER provides a DateTimeFormatter that is used to convert between LocalDate objects and String in common German notation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DateUtils() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int lastMonthForYear(TreeSet<org.joda.time.LocalDate> data, int year)
      The function lastMonthForYear() returns from an ordered set of dates for a given year the last month which a date can be found for in that year.
      static boolean sameMonth(org.joda.time.LocalDate compared, org.joda.time.LocalDate comparee)
      The function sameMonth() compares two LocalDate objects in regard to the question whether their two dates reside in the same month of the calendar system presumed.
      static boolean sameYear(org.joda.time.LocalDate current, org.joda.time.LocalDate next)
      The function sameYear() compares two LocalDate objects in regard to the question whether their two dates reside in the same year of the calendar system presumed.

        public static final org.joda.time.format.DateTimeFormatter DATE_FORMATTER

    • Method Detail

      • lastMonthForYear

        public static int lastMonthForYear(TreeSet<org.joda.time.LocalDate> data,
                                   int year)
        The function lastMonthForYear() returns from an ordered set of dates for a given year the last month which a date can be found for in that year.

        Example: Let the ordered data set contain: …, 5th May 1954, 20th May 1954, 13th October 1954, 5th February 1955, 23th March 1955, 15th October 1956, …. Then the function will return 10 (DateTimeConstants.OCTOBER) for 1954 and 3 (DateTimeConstants.MARCH) for 1955.

        Parameters:
        data - an ordered set of dates
        year - year in question
        Returns:
        the last month which can be found up to the end of that year

      • sameMonth

        public static boolean sameMonth(org.joda.time.LocalDate compared,
                                org.joda.time.LocalDate comparee)
        The function sameMonth() compares two LocalDate objects in regard to the question whether their two dates reside in the same month of the calendar system presumed. Two dates are considered to be in the same month exactly if both their year and month of year fields are equal.
        Parameters:
        compared - date to compare against
        comparee - date to compare, may be null
        Returns:
        whether the two dates are in the same month

      • sameYear

        public static boolean sameYear(org.joda.time.LocalDate current,
                               org.joda.time.LocalDate next)
        The function sameYear() compares two LocalDate objects in regard to the question whether their two dates reside in the same year of the calendar system presumed. Two dates are considered to be in the same year exactly if none of them is null and their year fields are equal.
        Parameters:
        current - date to compare against
        next - date to compare, may be null
        Returns:
        whether the two dates are in the same year
